revised_title: Investigation of the Black Colouring Matter in Bronchial Glands and Lungs
tldr: George Pearson investigates the black colouring matter found in bronchial glands and lungs, concluding that it is charcoal. He collects and analyzes samples from both bronchial glands and lung tissue, finding that the black matter is retained in the airways and transported to the bronchial glands.
